captions.text: Mighty Car Mods
As you probably know by now we love our Daihatsu Cuores
Now this particular model has a few features that we haven't seen on the other
versions of this car that we've bought. So i'm going to give you a walkaround and show you.
When you buy a car like this, you become a little bit like an automotive archeaologist
and you get a little bit of an understanding of the previous owner. So come with me lets have a walk
around. So over here, the car, did manage to escape
the transformers, thats where a decept-a-bot of some kind
reached out to grab it but the car was too fast. Being a 2002 model Cuore it has the updated
rear lights, you didn't know that did you. They're even - they're hanging out
a little bit. Now over here we've got the gaff tape.. umm..
oh.. is that meant to do that?
I'm not even going to talk about that, cause even talking about is going to brake it.
Someones backed into something there - that's awesome.
This is one of my favourite parts of the car here, this is where there's been a piece of masking tape used to hold
the fuel cap closed. Now the amazing thing about that is... that you never need
to open it, they are so economical! That's awesome. Now coming around to the front of course
You've got the sleek lines. Here's
a poor person has been run over, look at that... and they reached out with their
hand and went NO! - Let's go inside cause this is where the excitement
really starts to happen. We've got over here of course, the stealthy
gaff mirror there. That's awesome.
As we come inside there's a couple of mysteries. The first one is this..
So someone has drilled probably about a hundred holes in here to
remove this piece, and it looks like they've done a rough job, but amazingly
you can see they have actually marked it out, before they cut this piece out.
Now this serves no reasonable function whatsoever.
Whats that martin?
There's a glove in there.
Come on inside, let me show you all the parts that used to be there, that aren't there anymore.
So there's parts missing from here, now the dash is still a mystery
Oh.. that just fell off Martin - it wasn't me.
The dash is still a Mystery, its covered in tape
looks like shipping tape, maybe it used to be either a taxi
in Malaysia or some kind of courier van
Umm, the thing that is interesting about this car, is that i need you to come inside and have a look
at the human slime that's on the roof. Now i don't know if you can see
that, but what's interesting about, is that i'm reasonably tall and my
head, does not touch the roof at all.. the other thing is
that it's around about thirty centimeters in front of my head.. so
the persons head to be rubbing on that part of the car, they have to be
sitting...
like that. And their head
needs to be so tall it's touching the roof, so i'm assuming it was the worlds
tallest midget with an afro, and this is how they drove
now the other interesting thing is, if you stay on the outside
go around to the passenger side, cause i've got something interesting to show you over there
One of the other
mysteries that we think we've just uncovered, is down here
the door is covered in scratches, now we didn't know exactly what that was
what we've realised that whoever the passenger was in this car
was so hell bent, on getting out of this piece of turd
that they were ... ARRGHH... reaching, in slow motion
reaching.. for the door handle, and as such
have covered the paint work in these finger nail scratches in a vain attempt to get out
i mean, you can't get out..
the car could have been used as a kidnapping malaysian taxi
that was chased by autobots and driven by an african midget with
the longest head you've ever seen
